intro: Neurolobium, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species that are native to North America, particularly in the eastern and central regions. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating. They produce small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Neurolobium species are often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
